Time is running out PERIOD

And there is no better opportunity than tomorrow and Sunday for the Penn State mens tennis team to win its first Big Ten matches of the  season PERIOD

The Nittany Lions   Big Ten will travel for the second straight weekend to face No PERIOD  Purdue at  p.m. tomorrow at the Lafayette Sports Center PERIOD Before leaving Indiana the Lions will make a stop in Bloomington Ind. to face the No PERIOD  Hoosiers at noon Sunday PERIOD

Penn State junior Matt Nielsen said the Lions are ready to start winning some Big Ten matches PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Both the Boilermakers   and Hoosiers   faced Michigan and Michigan State last weekend PERIOD

Purdue first lost to the unranked Spartans  but then upset No PERIOD  Michigan by the same slim margin of  PERIOD Indiana was victorious against Michigan   by the final of  and swept the Spartans    PERIOD

The Hoosiers and Boilermakers both have a player listed among the Intercollegiate Tennis Associations top  singles players PERIOD

Indiana junior Milan Rakvica is No PERIOD  while Purdue junior Jason Marshall is No PERIOD  PERIOD That shows the Lions will face two teams this weekend that have proven success while competing in the Big Ten this year PERIOD

 Penn State coach Jan Bortner said PERIOD 

With the season quickly winding down the Lions have a chance to prove they have what it takes to have an influence on the Big Ten PERIOD Indiana and Purdue are among the top teams in the conference with a combined  record against fellow Big Ten teams PERIOD  Penn State senior MacrDorfman said of upcoming Big Tens PERIOD

Penn State senior Marc Dorfman who is sidelined with a hand injury said the Lions need to stop their setbacks in conference action or it will impact their placement in the Big Ten Championships PERIOD

Dorfmans teammate Jeff Martini agreed and said the whole season comes down to the Big Ten meet PERIOD

 Martini said PERIOD 

The Lions are on the downside of the betting line this week as they usually are when facing Big Ten teams but Bortner said his team is ready PERIOD

 he said PERIOD
